Banish until (temporarily banish a card).interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if that card is flipped face-down or leaves the field and it later appears on the field face-up once again, the same effect of cards with the same name can be activated[].

If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if that card leaves the field and returns to the field in the same turn, that card or cards with the same name cannot activate that effect in that turn. The same applies if "can only be used once per Duel" is written[].

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if control switches to the opponent, the effect cannot be activated[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example: You have activated the effect of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" that negates the activation of a Spell/Trap Card. If control of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" is now changed due to "Enemy Controller"'s effect, your opponent cannot use the same effect of that "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" this turn, even if they take control of it.
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Unqualified 'once per turn' and change of control

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if control switches to the opponent, monsters with the same name that the opponent controls can activate that effect[].

Change to Face-down Defense Position.interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if that card is flipped face-down or leaves the field and it later appears on the field face-up once again, the same effect of cards with the same name can be activated[].

If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if that card leaves the field and returns to the field in the same turn, that card or cards with the same name cannot activate that effect in that turn. The same applies if "can only be used once per Duel" is written[].

Properties Changing: Name changing.interaction: If an effect reads "You can only use this effect of [card name] once per turn" or "You can only use the effect of a card with this name once per turn", this is not influenced by changes to the card's name on the field[].
Properties Changing: Name changing.example: If the effect of "Giant Pairfish" that says "You can discard 1 monster; Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower Wyrm-Type monster from your Deck. You can only use this effect of "Giant Pairfish" once per turn." is activated, and later its name changes by the effect of another card, the effect of the "Giant Pairfish" that had its name changed during that turn cannot be activated.

Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.interaction: If the effects of another monster are gained by an effect that gains effects, the requirements to use that effect like "can only activate the effect of [card name] once per turn" are also applied[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.example: You control two "Therion" monsters, each equipped with a "Therion "Reaper" Fum". Due to the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum", both of these monsters have gained the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum", which allows to return cards on the field to the hand. During a single turn, you can only activate that effect of one of these monsters. You are considered to be using the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum" to return a card to the hand not only if you activate that effect of a "Therion "Reaper" Fum", but also if you activate that effect that another monster has gained. "Therion "Reaper" Fum"'s card text tells you that you can only use the effect to return to hand of "Therion "Reaper" Fum" once per turn. Therefore, you cannot use that effect twice during the same turn, even if different monsters have that effect.
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters gaining the effects of other monsters, and once-per-turn restrictions

Properties Changing: Copy effect resolve.interaction: Copying activated effects and named once per turn restrictions: this kind of effect "ignores" named once per turn restrictions[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect resolve.example: You can activate "Urgent Ritual Art" by banishing "Nekroz Kaleidoscope" during a turn in which the Ritual Summoning effect of "Nekroz Kaleidoscope" has been used. While resolving the effect of "Urgent Ritual Art", the effect of the banished Ritual Spell Card is performed as the resolution of the effect of "Urgent Ritual Art". Therefore, even in that case, "Urgent Ritual Art" can be activated by banishing "Nekroz Kaleidoscope".
Properties Changing: Copy effect resolve.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Copying activated effects and named once per turn restrictions

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: A monster you that leaves the field because used as a material (for example as Tribute or Link material) for an opponent's monster summoning procedures, it counts as having left the field by your opponent's card[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example: You control a Fusion Summoned "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon", and your opponent Tributes it to Special Summon "Gadarla, the Mystery Dust Kaiju" to my field. "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is considered to have left the field by the opponent and it can activate its effect. Also, if your opponent sends that "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" to the Graveyard as Link Material for the Link Summon of "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World", that effect can be activated as well.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Leaves the field by your opponent" and Summoning procedures

Unaffected.interaction: The text "You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card" of "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World" is not an effect, therefore an opponent's monster that is unaffected by monster effects can still be used as a Link Material[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World" using an opponent's monster that is unaffected

Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.interaction: Copying the effect of a card does not copy the maintenance cost[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.example: If "Legendary Knight Hermos" gains the effects of "Koa'ki Meiru Overload", the text that says "During each of your End Phases, destroy this card unless you send 1 "Iron Core of Koa'ki Meiru" from your hand to the Graveyard or reveal 1 Rock-Type monster in your hand." is not applied.

Declare 1 card name.interaction: A card named [X] whose text reads "this card is always treated as [Y]" cannot be declared by card name: when activating an effect that involves declaring a card name, you cannot declare [X] but you can declare [Y][].
Declare 1 card name.example: The card names "A Legendary Ocean" and "Lemuria, the Forgotten City" are always treated as "Umi". When declaring a card name, you cannot declare the card names "A Legendary Ocean" or "Lemuria, the Forgotten City". Both "A Legendary Ocean" and "Lemuria, the Forgotten City" are card names that are always treated as "Umi". Therefore, the original card name of these cards while they are being used in a Duel will also be "Umi". As a result, if you declare "Umi" when activating "Crossout Designator", you can banish either "Umi", "A Legendary Ocean", or "Lemuria, the Forgotten City" when "Crossout Designator" resolves. Regardless of which one you banish, the effect of "Crossout Designator" will apply to all cards whose original name is "Umi", which includes the cards A Legendary Ocean and Lemuria, the Forgotten City.
Declare 1 card name.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Umi", "Crossout Designator"

Properties Changing: Name changing.interaction: Archetype inclusion/exclusion "this card is always treated as [a particular title/archetype] card" clauses apply to a particular card name, not to a particular card: copying the name of a card with such clauses will copy also the "[a particular title/archetype]" clause[].
Properties Changing: Name changing.example: You activate the effect of "Crystal Rose", and when it resolves, you send "Brilliant Rose" to the Graveyard. As a result, the name of "Crystal Rose" is now treated as "Brilliant Rose". Due to "Brilliant Rose"'s text, it is also treated as a "Gem-Knight" card.
Properties Changing: Name changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Archetype inclusion/exclusion clauses apply to a particular card name, not to a particular card

Can only control 1: \"Rivalry of Warlord.interaction: If a monster was flipped face-up during the Damage Step and "Rivalry of Warlords"/"Gozen Match" is still active, if that monster has a Attribute/Type that conflicts with another monster already face-up on the field, the flipped monster will immediately be sent to the Graveyard at this point, but Flip Effects will still activate[].
Can only control 1: \"Rivalry of Warlord.reference: • Official KONAMI's FAQ of "Rivalry of Warlords" and "Gozen Match"

Reveal.interaction: Revealing a card does not activate its Flip effects[].

Change to Face-down Defense Position.interaction: You activate the effect of an Union Monster (1) that targets another monster (2) on your field and equips to it. If an effect (3) is chained that changes (1) to face-down Defense Position, when resolving the effect of (1), the effect is not applied (the face-down Defense Position (1) remains in the Monster Zone)[].
Change to Face-down Defense Position.example: You activate the effect of "Heavy Mech Support Armor" that equips it to a Machine-Type monster on my field, targeting "XYZ-Dragon Cannon". If "Book of Moon" is chained, and "Heavy Mech Support Armor" itself is changed to face-down Defense Position, when resolving the effect of "Heavy Mech Support Armor", if it has been changed to face-down Defense Position, the effect is not applied (the face-down Defense Position "Heavy Mech Support Armor" remains in the Monster Zone).
Change to Face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Heavy Mech Support Armor", "Book of Moon"

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Banish until (temporarily banish a card).interaction: A Gemini Monster that has been normal summoned again and gained its effects, if banished temporarily and subsequently returned to the field, it is treated as a Normal Monster again and its gained effect is no longer applied[].
Banish until (temporarily banish a card).example: "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is then Normal Summoned again so that its effect that treats its name as "Elemental HERO Neos" is applying. Afterward, "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter", and then returned to the field during the End Phase. In this scenario, it is treated as a Normal Monster again and its effect that treats its name as "Elemental HERO Neos" is no longer applied. Even in this case, "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is still treated as a Normal Summoned monster, and so it can be equipped with cards like "Bashing Shield".
Banish until (temporarily banish a card).reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Temporary banishment and Normal-Summoned-Again status

Cannot summon: Summon restrictions.interaction: Summoning a Gemini monsters is treated as summoning a normal monster, even if it will gain its effects on the moment its summon is successful[].
Cannot summon: Summon restrictions.example: Even if the effect of "Heat Wave" is applying, you can activate the effect of "Blazewing Butterfly" to Special Summon a Gemini monster from your Graveyard. The targeted monster will be Special Summoned and treated as an Effect Monster as usual.
Cannot summon: Summon restrictions.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Blazewing Butterfly", "Heat Wave"

Negate Effects.interaction: Gemini monsters which are treated as Normal Monsters by their "This card is treated as a Normal Monster while face-up on the field or in the Graveyard." effect are also monsters to which the "its effects are negated" effect can be applied[].
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Activation legality for effect negation

Negate Effects.interaction: If a Gemini monster has its effects negated, it also cannot be Normal Summoned again[].
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Normal Summoning a negated Gemini Monster

Negate Effects.interaction: If a Gemini monster treated as a Normal Monster has its effects negated, the effect that says "This card is treated as a Normal Monster while face-up on the field or in the Graveyard" is negated and it is treated as an Effect Monster[].
If a Gemini monster treated as an Effect Monster has its effects negated, the effects after the "•" are negated and it is treated as an Effect Monster[].
Negate Effects.example: A Gemini monster that is attacked and destroyed in battle by "Dark Ruler Ha Des" has its effects negated by the effect of "Dark Ruler Ha Des" that says "Negate the effects of monsters destroyed by battle with Fiend-Type monsters you control", and it is treated as an Effect Monster as long as it is in the Graveyard.

Negate Summons.interaction: When a Gemini monster on the field is Normal Summoned once again, cards that negate that Normal Summon can be activated. A Gemini monster that has its Summon negated is not treated as being destroyed and sent to the Graveyard from the hand or field[].

Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.interaction: If the effects of a Gemini Monster (1) are gained by a Monster (2) that has an effect that gains effects, (2) will be treated as a Normal Monster, but can be Normal Summoned again to gain the listed effect of (1)[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.example: If you activate "Neo-Spacian Dark Panther"'s effect by targeting a Gemini monster such as "Chthonian Emperor Dragon", "Neo-Spacian Dark Panther" will gain the effects of the targeted Gemini monster. As a result, it will be treated as a Normal Monster, but can be Normal Summoned again to gain the listed effect.
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Neo-Spacian Dark Panther", "Chthonian Emperor Dragon"

Banish.interaction: The Token stops existing, but this event is not treated as a card being banished[].
Banish.example: The effect of "Soul Absorption" does not activate if a "Sheep Token" you control is banished by the effect of an opponent's "Caius the Shadow Monarch": at the time the token would leave the field it stops existing, and as a result, a card is not banished.
Banish.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Soul Absorption" and Tokens

Banish until (temporarily banish a card).interaction: The Token disappears and won't reapper again even when the effect of temporarily banishing stops applying[].
Banish until (temporarily banish a card).example: You have resolved "S:P Little Knight"'s "banish both [targeted monsters] until the End Phase" effect, banishing both itself and a Token. The targeted Token disappears, and "S:P Little Knight" is banished until the End Phase. At that point, "S:P Little Knight" returns to the Monster Zone as usual.
Banish until (temporarily banish a card).reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "S:P Little Knight" more interactions

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token[].
Equipping Monsters.example: "The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. For example, if a "Photon Token" that was Special Summoned by the effect of Photon Sanctuary is equipped to "The Grand Jupiter", the second effect of "The Grand Jupiter" will increase its own ATK by the original ATK of the equipped "Photon Token", which is 2000.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token

Return/Add to the Hand.example: You can target a Token Monster with the effect of "Fairy Tail - Luna". The Token is removed from the field and "Fairy Tail - Luna" is returned to the hand as normal.
Return/Add to the Hand.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Fairy Tail - Luna" and Tokens

Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.interaction: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone[].
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.example: "The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. The equipped Token cannot be targeted when activating the last effect of "The Grand Jupiter" that Special Summons one of the monsters equipped to it.
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone

Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.interaction: Another example being "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye": it cannot summon a Token from the Spell/Trap Zone[].
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye"

Change to Face-down Defense Position.interaction: If a card that has counters placed on itself is flipped face-down, those counters are removed[].

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters that can only be placed on a particular card like itself are placed on a card that has its effects negated, those counters are removed[].
Negate Effects.example: If a "Gateway to Chaos" that had Spell Counters placed on itself by its effect that says "Each time a Monster Card(s) is sent from the hand or field to the Graveyard, place 1 Spell Counter on this card for each of those cards" has its effects negated by an effect like "Silent Swordsman LV7", the Spell Counters are removed.

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters are placed on another card by an effect that places counters, even if the effects of that card are negated, the counters are not removed[].
Negate Effects.example: Ice Counters placed by the effect of "Snowdust Giant" that says "reveal any number of WATER monsters from your hand, and place that many Ice Counters on face-up monsters on the field" are not removed if "Snowdust Giant" has its effects negated.

Unaffected.interaction:
Placing a counter affects the monster[]:
  • A monster (1) that has a counter placed on it and an effect is applying to all monsters with that counter (2). Even if (1) becomes unaffected by cards' effects, the counter is not removed and (2) keeps applying and affecting (1).
  • A monster (1) is unaffected or becomes unaffected by cards' effects. Subsequent effects that try to put counters on (1) will not put any counter on (1).
Unaffected.example: A monster has had a "Cubic Counter" placed on it by the effect of "Vijam the Cubic Seed". Once a monster has had a "Cubic Counter" placed on it, even if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" is then applied to the monster, the "Cubic Counter" is not removed. That monster remains unable to attack, and its effects remain negated. Conversely, if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" has already been applied to a monster, and that monster then battles a "Vijam the Cubic Seed" whose effect then resolves, no "Cubic Counter" will be placed on the monster (As a result, its effects will not be negated, and it will still be able to attack).
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Placing a counter affects the monster

Cannot/Neither player can.interaction: If a continuous effect that says "[X] cannot be activated" is applying, you still cannot activate [X] through another card's effect[].
Cannot/Neither player can.example: The effect of "Metaverse" either adds a Field Spell Card from your Deck to your hand, or activates one from your Deck. While the effect of "Anti-Spell Fragrance" is applying, you can still activate "Metaverse", but the effect of "Anti-Spell Fragrance" prevents you from activating Spell Cards that were not Set first. Therefore, the Field Spell Card must be added to your hand.
Cannot/Neither player can.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Anti-Spell Fragrance", "Metaverse"

Each time [A] happens, do [B]: Continuou.interaction: Continuous effects that say "Each time [X] is activated, do [B]" won't apply [B] if [X] is activated by another card effect[].
Each time [A] happens, do [B]: Continuou.example: If a Spell Card is activated by another effect, "Skilled Blue Magician"'s"each time a Spell Card is activated, place 1 Spell Counter on this card when that Spell resolves" effect will not be applied, and no Spell Counters are placed as a result of that activation. If "Demise of the Land" is activated, one Spell Counter is placed on "Skilled Blue Magician" (it is placed as a result of "Demise of the Land"'s own activation).
Each time [A] happens, do [B]: Continuou.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Demise of the Land", "Skilled Blue Magician"

Cannot switch control/possession.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot attach (1) to a monster you control (2) as material as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster, therefore a card or effect that involves such action cannot be activated[].
Cannot switch control/possession.example: Your opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10" , and its "● 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied. In this scenario, you cannot activate the effect of your "Cyber Dragon Infinity" that attaches the target to it as material by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10".
Cannot switch control/possession.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Cyber Dragon Infinity"

Change to Face-down Defense Position.interaction: If an effect (1) that involves attaching a card (2) as an Xyz Material to a Xyz Monster on the field (3) is activated, if (3) is flipped face-down by another card's effect, then (1) resolves still by attaching (2) to (3)[].
Change to Face-down Defense Position.example: If "Overlay Regen" is activated, but "Book of Moon" is chained so that the targeted Xyz Monster is in face-down Defense Position when "Overlay Regen" resolves, at the time "Overlay Regen" resolves, even if the targeted Xyz Monster is now face-down, the effect of attaching "Overlay Regen" to it as an Xyz Material still applies as usual.
Change to Face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Overlay Regen", "Book of Moon"

Unaffected.interaction: If an effect (1) that involves attaching a card (2) as an Xyz Material to a Xyz Monster on the field (3) is activated, if (3) is unaffected by cards' effects, then (1) resolves without attaching (2) to (3)[].
Unaffected.example: If "Overlay Regen" is activated, but "Forbidden Lance" is chained so that the targeted monster becomes unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects, it is not possible to attach "Overlay Regen" to the targeted monster as an Xyz Material, as it is unaffected by Spell effects. As a result, "Overlay Regen" is sent to the Graveyard. Also, if "Overlay Regen" is activated by targeting a monster that has already become unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects because of "Forbidden Lance", it is still not possible to attach "Overlay Regen" to the targeted monster as an Xyz Material.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attaching material affects the monster being attached to

Attack directly.interaction:
Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once and can attack directly[]:
  • After attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each.
  • If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.example: If the effect of "Bujingi Ophidian" is applied to "Bujintei Susanowo", after attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each. If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once each cannot attack the opponent directly afterwards and vice versa

Change attack target.interaction: If a monster (1) can attack all opponent's monsters once each, if it attacks a monster (2) but then its attack is redirected to another monster (3), (1) cannot attack again (2). Furthermore, (3) which has been made the attack target instead of (2), if (3) has not been destroyed by battle after the attack redirection, (1) cannot attack again (3)[].
Change attack target.example: A "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike" attacks an opponent's "Ruffian Railcar", but the opponent activates the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" from their hand, and damage calculation is performed. In this case, since the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" makes itself the attack target, it cannot be attacked again by "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike". In addition, the "Ruffian Railcar" which was attacked when the opponent activated the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" also cannot be attacked again.
Change attack target.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attack target redirection and effects that allow attacking all monsters, once each

Negate Effects.interaction:
A monster (1) that can attack all opponent's monsters once each declares its second (or more) attack during the current Battle Phase (a continuous effect is applying). If (1)'s effects become negated[]:
  • If its effects are negated during the Battle Step, it will no longer be possible to continue that attack, or to make additional attacks.
  • If its effects are negated during the Damage Step (by "Forbidden Droplet" for example), damage calculation will be conducted for that attack normally.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Multiple attacks, and the monster's effects being negated while attacking

Negate Effects.interaction:
A monster (1) is in face-up Defense Position and its effect that allows it to attack while in face-up Defense Position applies. If you declare an attack using this effect and an effect (2) that negates (1)'s effects is activated or applied[]:
  • If (1)'s effects are negated during the Battle Step by (2), (1) can no longer attack while being in face-up Defense Position. In this case, the attack stops without entering the Damage Step.
  • If (1)'s effects are negated during the Damage Step, the Damage Step ends without conducting Damage Calculation.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attacking in Defense Position, and negating the attacking monster's effects

Negate Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that banish cards (2) is chained to banish (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be banished due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Negate Effects.example: You chained "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to be banished. Its effect will be negated.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: A Trap Treated as a Monster (not treated as a Trap) is being banished until the End Phase by a card effect. Once the Trap returns to the field to the Monster Zone during the End Phase, it will no longer be treated as a monster, and will immediately be sent to the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example: You have resolved "S:P Little Knight"'s "banish both [targeted monsters] until the End Phase" effect, banishing both itself and "Traptrix Holeutea". Both cards are banished, and both return to the Monster Zone during the End Phase. At that point, "Traptrix Holeutea" is immediately sent to the Graveyard.
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "S:P Little Knight" more interactions

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: A Trap Treated as a Monster (strill treated as a Trap) is being banished until the End Phase by a card effect. Once the Trap returns to the field to the Monster Zone during the End Phase, it will no longer be treated as a monster, and will immediately be sent to the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Temporary banishment & Trap Monsters

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: You can take control of an opponent's monster that's the wrong Type/Attribute with a card like "Mind Control". If you do, it's sent to the Graveyard immediately after you gain control of it[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • Official KONAMI's FAQ of "Rivalry of Warlords" and "Gozen Match"

Immediately after this effect resolves,.interaction:
"There Can Be Only One" (1) is set on your opponent's field[].
  • You can activate an effect (2) as Chain Link 1 that summons back monsters (3) from a location (like the Graveyard) to the field and immediately after at resolution performs a Special Summon of a monster (4)
  • Your opponent chains as Chain Link 2 (1). The chain resolves backwards, and you have to summon monsters that don't violate (1), which means they have a different Type from the monsters you control. If you do not have any, (2) resolves without summoning anything.
  • When (3) are summoned back to the field, if two or more monsters in (3) have the same Type, due to (1) you have to keep monsters till you only control one of the same Type. If doing so the number of monsters summoned (3) changes and you cannot summon (4) anymore, then (2) resolves without performing the Special Summon.
Immediately after this effect resolves,.example: The only monster in your Monster Zone is "Bujinki Ahashima". If you activate its effect that Special Summons 2 monsters with the same Level and performs an Xyz Summon, if your opponent chains "There Can Be Only One", since "Bujinki Ahashima" is a Beast-Warrior monster, you cannot Special Summon any Beast-Warrior monsters from your hand or Graveyard with its effect. If you do not have any non-Beast-Warrior monsters in your hand or Graveyard to Special Summon, you cannot Special Summon any monsters. If, for example, you Special Summon a Winged Beast-Type "Bujingi Crane" from your hand and a Beast-Type "Bujingi Turtle" from your Graveyard, you can then perform an Xyz Summon using those 2 monsters. However, if you choose 1 "Bujingi Crane" from your hand and 1 "Bujingi Crane" from your Graveyard, both are Special Summoned successfully, but the effect of "There Can Be Only One" will be applied, you must send 1 of the "Bujingi Crane"s to the Graveyard, and the Xyz Summon cannot be performed.
Immediately after this effect resolves,.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Floodgates & summon-immediately-after

Properties Changing.interaction:
A card (1) with the restriction of "you cannot Normal or Special Summon except X monsters the turn you activate this card" is applying. Normally, if you Summon a monster (2) which violates the restriction of (1), then (1) cannot be activated. Similarly, if you activate (1) first (2) cannot be Summoned. But if[]:
  • A card (3) has an effect that applies to (2) such that when (2) is Summoned it does not violate the restriction of (1), then (1) can be activated after (2) has been Summoned.
  • A card (3) has an effect that applies to (2) such that when (2) is Summoned it does not violate the restriction of (1), but you have already activated (1) before (2) is Summoned, then (2) cannot be Summoned anymore.
Properties Changing.example:
"A DNA Transplant" that was activated by declaring the LIGHT Attribute is face-up on the field. In this situation, I activate "Monster Reborn" and Special Summon "Darklord Superbia" from my Graveyard, then activate its effect and Special Summon "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra" from the Graveyard:
  • Even if you Special Summoned a "Darklord Superbia" (whose original Attribute is DARK) this turn, if you did so while the effect of "A DNA Transplant" was applying declaring LIGHT, you can activate the effect of "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra".
  • However, if you first activated the effect of "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra", you cannot Special Summon monsters whose original Attributes are anything other than LIGHT, even if the effect of "A DNA Transplant" is applying.
Properties Changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Property changing and being treated as having Special Summoned monsters with a given property

Properties Changing.interaction: An effect (1) is applying so that monsters with a certain specific property X cannot be summoned, but monsters with another specific property Y can be summoned. A monster (2)'s has X property, so (2) can't be summoned due to (1). If (2) has an effect that says "summon this card as a monster with Y property", then (2) can be summoned through that effect[].
Properties Changing.example: Your opponent controls "Evilswarm Ophion", which has materials attached and is applying its effect "Level 5 or higher monsters cannot be Special Summoned". "Cockadoodledoo" has effects that say "you can Special Summon this card (from your hand) as a Level 3 monster" or "you can Special Summon this card (from your hand) as a Level 4 monster", so you can Special Summon "Cockadoodledoo" using either of its effects.
Properties Changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters being summoned "as a monster with Y property", and restrictions on summoning monsters with/without a specific property X

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If the only monsters your opponent controls are monsters whose control/possession cannot switch, you cannot activate an effect that would take control of an opponent's monster[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example: When your "Goyo King" destroys an opponent's monster by battle, if the only monster your opponent controls is that "Botanical Lion" hose effect is applying (control of it cannot switch), you cannot activate the effect of "Goyo King" that takes control of your opponent's monster.
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Activation legality for attempting to take control

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot equip (1) to a monster you control (2) as an equip card as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster[].
Equipping Monsters.example: Your opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10" , and its "● 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied. In this scenario, you cannot activate the effect of your "Relinquished" that that equips the target to it by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10".
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Relinquished"

Must attack.interaction: If you control a monster (1) that says "monsters your opponent controls that can attack must attack this card" and a card that prevents (1) from being targeted for attacks, your opponent's monsters must attack (1) due to its effect[].
Must attack.example: If you control a "Puppet Rook", which is treated as a Fiend due to a card effect, and a "Labrynth Archfiend", your opponent's monsters must attack "Puppet Rook" due to its effect.
Must attack.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Must attack" & "cannot be targeted for attacks"

Unaffected.interaction: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting[].
Unaffected.example: You control a face-up "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and a face-up "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin", and the opponent controls a "Skypalace Gangaridai" affected by the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora". The effect of "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" that prevents other "Ninja" Monsters you control from being targeted for attacks is an effect that affects the monsters performing attacks. Therefore, in the proposed scenario, since "Skypalace Gangaridai" is not affected by the effects of other cards, "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin" can be targeted for an attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting

Unaffected.interaction: This is true for both effects that say "monsters your opponent controls cannot target X for attacks" like "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and effects that say "your opponent cannot target X for attacks" like "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode": a monster unaffected by those cards can still target them for attacks[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode"

Unaffected.interaction: If you are not applying an effect to the monster, preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster[].
Unaffected.example: "Ancient Gear Fortress" and a "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" which you Fusion Summoned this turn are on the field. Since "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" is unaffected by Spell effects, the "they cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not apply to it. (For example, it could be destroyed by your opponent's monster effects). However, the "your opponent cannot target "Ancient Gear" monsters you control with card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not affect monsters. Therefore, your opponent will still be unable to target "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" with card effects this turn.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster (Unless you are applying an effect to the monster)

End the Battle Phase.interaction: If your opponent attacks and an effect (1) that "changes attack target and performs damage calculation" is activated, then you chain an effect (2) that ends the Battle Phase, due to the effect of (2) resolving, the effect of (1) resolves during the End Step of the Battle Phase. Because the attack is completed, you do not perform damage calculation[].
End the Battle Phase.example: During your opponent's turn, if your opponent attacks your "Decoy Dragon" and its effect is activated, and you chain the effect of "Electromagnetic Turtle", due to the effect of "Electromagnetic Turtle" resolving, the effect of "Decoy Dragon" resolves during the End Step of the Battle Phase. The targeted Dragon-Type monster is still Special Summoned from your Graveyard, but because the attack is completed, you do not perform damage calculation.
End the Battle Phase.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Decoy Dragon", "Electromagnetic Turtle"

Unaffected.interaction: Changing the attack target affects the monster[].
Unaffected.example: When your opponent's "Tatsunoko" attacks directly, you activate the effect of a "Dark Spirit of Banishment" in your hand at the start of the Damage Step, targeting a "Curse Necrofear" in your Graveyard. In this scenario, since your opponent's "Tatsunoko" is unaffected by monster effects, it is unaffected by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment" that changes its attack target and performs damage calculation. Although "Curse Necrofear" is still Special Summoned by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment", it does not become the new attack target, so "Tatsunoko" continues its attack normally as a direct attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing the attack target affects the monster

Negate Activation of Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates the activation of the effects (2) is chained to negate the activations of the effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The the Chain resolves in reverse order and (1) will still negate the (2)'s effects activation[].
Negate Activation of Effects.example: When you Tribute Summon "Mobius the Frost Monarch", you activate its effect. However, your opponent activates the effect of "Stardust Dragon" in response. If you now further activate "Book of Moon" by targeting your "Mobius the Frost Monarch", this chain resolves backwards, and causes "Mobius the Frost Monarch" to be face-down by the time "Stardust Dragon"'s effect resolves. Even if "Mobius the Frost Monarch" is changed to face-down Defense Position, the effect of "Stardust Dragon" will still negate the activation of "Mobius the Frost Monarch"'s effect, and destroy "Mobius the Frost Monarch".
Negate Activation of Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating the activation of a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Effects.interaction: Consider effects that say "when an effect is activated: [cost]; negate the/that effect" (negating activated effect) like "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates monster's activated effects (2) is chained to negate the activated effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), and the effects of (1) will be still negated[]
Negate Effects.example: When my Level 5 or higher monster activates its effect, "Xyz Wrath" is activated in response. If "Book of Moon" is then activated in response, causing the Level 5 or higher monster to be in face-down Defense Position by the time "Xyz Wrath" resolves, the effect of "Xyz Wrath" will be applied normally (the activated effect is negated, and the monster is destroyed).
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Effects.interaction: Consider effects that negate effects but not the activated effects like "Forbidden Chalice". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (2) is chained to flip (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of (3) will not be applied once (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), so the effect of (1) will not be negated[].
Negate Effects.example: You chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even if a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card is flipped face-down by the effect of "Book of Moon" or something similar, it is flipped face-down in the Main Monster Zone. If it is flipped face-up again, it is treated as a Monster according to what its text indicates[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: If a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card by its own effect is flipped face-down by an effect, it is placed face-down in the Spell & Trap Zone. It can be activated in the next turn and become a Monster Card once again[].
Changing from Monster Trap to Trap, it does not create a new copy[]
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example: If the second effect of "Galaxy Cyclone" is activated by targeting an "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster, and then "Book of Moon" is chained so that "Embodiment of Apophis" is Set, the targeted card is destroyed normally.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing from Monster+Trap to Trap does not create a new copy

If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.interaction: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile[].
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.example: You have "Toon Kingdom" face-up on your side of the field, and you activate "Comic Hand" by targeting an opponent's "Spirit Reaper". When "Comic Hand" resolves, you take control of the "Spirit Reaper" that was targeted, and it will be treated as a Toon monster. After you gain control of "Spirit Reaper", its effect that destroys it when it is targeted by a card or effect will apply. In this case, you can apply the last effect of "Toon Kingdom" once, and banish the top card of your Deck face-down, but the effect of "Spirit Reaper" will immediately apply again, resulting in "Spirit Reaper" being destroyed.
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile

Return/Add to the Hand.interaction: If cards from the Deck are added to the hand by an effect that does not draw cards but "adds them to the hand", this is not treated as drawing cards[].
Return/Add to the Hand.example: If a card is added to the hand by the effect of "Pot of Duality" that says "Excavate the top 3 cards of your Deck, add 1 of them to your hand, also, after that, shuffle the rest back into your Deck.", this is not treated as drawing cards.

Return/Add to the Hand.interaction: Cards that are drawn are treated as being added to the hand[].
Return/Add to the Hand.example: "R-Genex Accelerator" was face-up on your field when you performed your normal draw for the Draw Phase. If the card you draw is a "Genex" monster, even if a "Genex" monster is added to your hand by drawing, it is considered to have been added from your Deck to your hand. Therefore, in this scenario, you can activate the effect of "R-Genex Accelerator".
Return/Add to the Hand.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "R-Genex Accelerator"

Negate Summons.interaction:
The Special Summon of a monster when resolving an effect that happens later (during the End Phase for example) does not start a chain such as "Spellbook of Judgment".
  • As it is a Special Summon of a monster due an effect, this Special Summon cannot be negated by activating effects that negate summons like "Black Horn of Heaven"[].
  • However, it is still an "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)", so cards like "Solemn Warning" can be activated in response[].
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating delayed Special Summons

Unaffected by activated effects.interaction: Effects that apply later (delayed effects) also applies after the Chain Link formed by their activation has finished resolving. Therefore, they can also affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects"[].
Unaffected by activated effects.example: "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect will destroy "Cyberdark End Dragon" during the End Phase.
Unaffected by activated effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unaffected by activated effects" and what it means

Leaves the field.interaction: A monster on the field becoming an Equip Spell is not treated as the monster "leaving the field"[].
Leaves the field.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Relay Soul" and monster moved to Spell & Trap Zone

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: If your opponent fails to equip a monster you control to a monster your opponent's controls, this is not treated as "leaving the field because of your opponent's card"[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example: Your opponent activates the effect of their "Relinquished Anima", targeting your Fusion Summoned "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon". In response, you activate the effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon", which banishes a monster on the field. When this chain resolves, you banish "Relinquished Anima", therefore, "Relinquished Anima" no longer exists on the field when its effect resolves, and "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is sent to the Graveyard instead of becoming an Equip Card. In the situation, "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is not treated as being sent to the Graveyard by your opponent. Therefore, that effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" cannot be activated.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Leaves the field by your opponent" and failing to equip

Negate Effects.interaction: If a monster that has been equipped with Equip Cards by its effect has its effects negated, they are destroyed and sent to the Graveyard[].
Negate Effects.example: While "Guardian of Felgrand" has been equipped with a card by its effect that says "If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can equip 1 Level 7 or 8 Dragon-Type monster from your hand or Graveyard to this card.", if the effect of "Skill Drain" is applied, the effects of "Guardian of Felgrand" are negated and the monster that was equipped is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard.

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Unaffected.interaction: Substitution does not affect the protected monster[].
Unaffected.example: If your "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV6", which is unaffected by Spell effects due to its own effect, would be destroyed by battle or card effect, you can apply the effect of "Return of the Dragon Lords" in my Graveyard.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substitution does not affect the protected monster

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: Monsters used as materials in this way do not "leave the field by a card effect"[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "I:P Masquerena", "Granguignol the Dusk Dragon"

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: The activation of a card or of an effect that "Immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X]" can be negated by cards that are able to negate "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)"[].
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Special Summons caused by a card effect, and whether the effect includes Special Summoning

Negate Activation of Effects.interaction: The activation of a card or of an effect can be negated by cards that are able to negate "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)"[].
Negate Activation of Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Special Summons caused by a card effect, and whether the effect includes Special Summoning

Negate Summons.interaction: The Summon of that monster(s) can be negated if the effect resolves as Chain Link 1[].
Negate Summons.example: If "Tenpai Dragon Chundra"'s effect of was activated as Chain Link 1, the effect of "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended" can be activated during the attempt to Synchro Summon; if the effect of "Tenpai Dragon Chundra" was activated as Chain Link 2 or higher, it cannot be.
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Tenpai Dragon Chundra", "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended"

Properties Changing.interaction:
An effect (1) is applying that changes properties of monsters face-up on the field.
  • You can activate an effect (2) that summons back monsters (3) from a location (like the Graveyard) to the field and immediately after at resolution performs a Special Summon of a monster (4), as long as (3) and their properties satisfied the summoning requirements for (4) when (3) were in their original location (like the Graveyard).
  • But when (3) are summoned back to the field, as (1) is applying, if (1) changes (3)'s properties so that you can't summon (4) at resolution anymore, you must summon another monster that can be summoned with (3) after their properties have changed from the same location(s) of (4).
  • If there are no monsters that can be summoned from the location(s) of (4), after summoning back (3), (2) resolves without performing the Special Summon[].
Properties Changing.example: "Stygian Dirge" is face-up on the field. You can activate "Geargia Change" targeting "Geargiano" monsters that are Level 3 in your Graveyard, as long as you are able to Xyz Summon a Rank 3 monster using the targeted monsters. In this scenario, since the Levels of the targeted monsters are reduced by 1 after being Special Summoned, you cannot Xyz Summon a Rank 3 monster, and you must instead Xyz Summon a Rank 2 monster if one exists in your Extra Deck. At this time, if you do not have a Rank 2 monster in your Extra Deck, the Xyz Summon is not performed.
Properties Changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Summon-immediately-after & monsters' properties changing after being Summoned

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: Negating a card's activation (not effect's activation) removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field[].
Negate Activation of Cards.example: A "Super Soldier Shield" was set on the field by its own effect. That "Super Soldier Shield" is activated, and it has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit". Since the "Super Soldier Shield" that has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit" is not considered to leave the field, it is not banished and is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard normally.
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a card's activation removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field

Place a card on the field in your Spell/.interaction: Placing a monster on the field in a Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone is not treated as the monster "leaving the field". However, the effects of "Pumprincess the Princess of Ghosts", of "Dragunity Javelin", or of "Tiki Soul", may place destroyed monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone instead. In this case, that monster is treated as having left the field first[].
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Relay Soul" and monster moved to Spell & Trap Zone

Return/Shuffle to the Deck.interaction: When a monster on the field is shuffled into the Deck, it is no longer a card on the field, however its effects that activate when it "leaves the field" will not activate[]. Deck includes both Main and Extra Deck.

Unaffected.interaction: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card[].
Unaffected.example: Your opponent activates the effect of "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" that destroys 1 other card on the field, while it is also unaffected by monster and Trap effects as a result of being Tribute Summoned by Tributing a monster and a Continuous Trap Card. In this case, if you chain "Recall", since "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" is unaffected by Trap Cards, the activation of its effect is not negated by "Recall" and it is not destroyed, so its effect destroys the targeted card normally. Even in that case, your opponent draws 1 card.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card

Properties Changing.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Properties Changing.example: The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8. Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated. In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel". Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
Properties Changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.example: The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8. Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated. In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel". Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Properties Changing: Name changing.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Properties Changing: Name changing.example: The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8. Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated. In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel". Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
Properties Changing: Name changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Return/Add to the Hand.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that returns cards to the hand (2) is chained to return (1) to the hand. Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be returned to the hand due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Return/Add to the Hand.example: You chained "Compulsory Evacuation Device" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to be returned to the hand. Its effect will be negated.
Return/Add to the Hand.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.interaction: A face-up card has applied an effect that lasts for this turn. If in this same turn that card has its effects negated, the previously applied effect will still linger for the turn[].
This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.example: You successfully Fusion Summoned a "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" and activated its effect this turn. If "Skill Drain" is activated after the effect of "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" has resolved, and its effects are negated, "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" will no longer lose 1000 ATK, but it will still be able to attack directly with its effect that turn.
This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride", "Skill Drain"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even when a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card has its effects negated, it remains in the Main Monster Zone[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction:
• After you negate monster effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated, so the card remains in the Monster Zone[].
  • After you negate trap effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up (even if the negation effect is no longer applied, the Trap Card will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again)[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
A Continuous Trap Card that has an effect of becoming a monster, such as "Angel Statue - Azurune", has been Special Summoned to your Monster Zone by applying its own Trap Effect:

  • If the effect of a previously Set "Infinite Impermanence" that negates all other Spell/Trap effects in its column is applied to "Angel Statue - Azurune" in the Monster Zone, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up. (even if the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" is no longer applied, "Angel Statue - Azurune" will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again).
  • However, if just the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" that negates the effects of its target applies to "Angel Statue - Azurune" that is treated as an Effect Monster, only its Monster Effects will be negated. In this case, its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated, so "Angel Statue - Azurune" remains in the Monster Zone.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating monster effects of a Monster/Trap hybrid

Unaffected.interaction: Cards that become unaffected after a lingering effect has activated and is already applying, will be unaffected by that lingering effect[].
Unaffected.example: "Diamond Core of Koa'ki Meiru"'s effect in the Graveyard has been applied this turn, "Koa'ki Meiru" monsters you control cannot be destroyed. If "Forbidden Lance" is later applied to your "Koa'ki Meiru Overload", causing it target to become unaffected by Spell effects, so the effect of "Diamond Core of Koa'ki Meiru" will not be applied to that unaffected monster. In this situation, if your opponent then activates "Nekroz of Gungnir"'s effect targeting your "Koa'ki Meiru Overload", "Koa'ki Meiru Overload" will be destroyed as normal by the effect of "Nekroz of Gungnir".
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Diamond Core of Koa'ki Meiru", "Forbidden Lance"

During the [X] Phase, [A]: Delayed effec.interaction: An effect that resolves at a later point, moving a card(s) in the GY to a different place, can be activated when "Necrovalley" is face-up on the field and its effect will not be negated. If at the time of the delayed effect resolution "Necrovalley" is still face-up on the field, that effect won't resolve successfully and won't move any card in the GY. If on other hand "Necrovalley" is not face-up on the field anymore, then that effect resolves normally by moving a card(s) in the GY[].
During the [X] Phase, [A]: Delayed effec.example: If "Harpie Oracle" is Normal or Special Summoned and activates its effect while the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying, as in this scenario, the effect will not be negated. However, if the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying during the End Phase when you apply "Harpie Oracle"'s effect, you cannot add an appropriate Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand. (If the effect of "Necrovalley" has stopped applying by the time you reach the End Phase, you can add the Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand normally)
During the [X] Phase, [A]: Delayed effec.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Necrovalley and delayed effects

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: The player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example: When your opponent Special Summoned "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" this turn, you activated the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill". During the same turn, if that "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" leaves the field after its control was changed by the effect of "Creature Swap", the player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field (in this scenario, since you were the controller of "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon", you take 3000 damage).
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" and changing control

Unaffected.interaction: You can use "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targeting a monster unaffected by cards effects. In this scenario, the monster's effects won't be negated but the controller of that monster will still take damage when it leaves the field[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targets a monster that is unaffected
